intro: Erigeron incomptus, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open areas such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a hairy texture, and its flowers are usually pale yellow to white. Erigeron incomptus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
